comment.author: 60406173@N04
comment._content: Makandanji was a Yao chief on the southeast shore of the lake who resisted but was subdued by a British anti-slavery force under Captain Maguire in 1891.  Johnston (British Central Africa, p101) wrote "We...on one day, concluded trreaties with Mponda, Zarafi and Makandanji, and seemed to have accomplished the pacification of South Nyasa."
